abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Agricultural Sector
            Adjustment Project will help support the government's
            objectives of increasing the agricultural growth rate,
            raising productivity, improving agricultural sector
            efficiency through functioning output and input markets, and
            poverty alleviation of the most vulnerable population groups
            through food programs.  This loan will support:  (a) trade
            and policy reforms that increase competition and reduce the
            government's role in the production, planning,
            marketing, storage and processing of agricultural products
            and inputs, and encourage private sector competition; (b)
            revision of government expenditure allocation in consumer
            programs by eliminating generalized food subsidies and
            increasing spending for improved food assistance and
            nutrition program targeting; and (c) the institutional
            transition of the Ministry of Agriculture and Hydraulic
            Resources to a smaller but more effective agriculture role,
            emphasizing policy formulation, implementation and basic
            regulatory functions.  The program includes measures to
            reform agricultural product price and  trade policy regime,
            abolish the system of mandatory production planning for
            agricultural products, reduce and streamline market
            regulations and barriers to entry and competition, and make
            food consumption and nutrition programs more cost effective
            and successful by increasing coverage and improving
            targeting of the poorer population.
